properties.description:
1. A-phase voltage, current, and power
2. Big-endian mode, HEX format, 8 bytes total
3. Units and precision:
   - Voltage: 2 bytes, in increments of 0.1 V
   - Current: 3 bytes, in increments of 0.001 A
   - Active power of A-phase: 3 bytes, in increments of 0.0001 kW
4. Example packet:
   08 80 00 03 E8 00 27 10 => A-phase voltage is 217.6 V, current is 1.000 A, and power is 10.000 kW
5. Communication logic:
   - When a user enters the panel, it actively queries the meter (sending 0x08). The meter reports data, which the panel then displays.
   - The meter also reports data periodically: recommended 15s in Wi-Fi mode, 1h in NB mode.
properties.name: A-phase voltage, current, and power

properties.description:
1. Alarm
2. Big-endian mode, HEX, 4 bytes
3. Packet format:
   - 4 bytes in total; each bit indicates if an alarm is active (1) or inactive (0). Unused bits are set to 0.
   - Example: 0x00 00 00 09 => "self-test leakage abnormal" and "short-circuit" alarms are active.
4. Communication logic:
   - Whenever an alarm is triggered or cleared, the full 4-byte packet is reported to update the panel.
properties.name: Fault alarm

properties.description:
1. Alarm threshold enable and configuration
2. HEX format, Big-endian, total alarms * 4 bytes = total alarm length
3. Packet format:
   - Each alarm is 4 bytes:
     (1) Byte 1 => alarm present (1) or not (0)
     (2) Byte 2 => if triggered, breaker action (0x01 = trip, 0x00 = no trip, just alarm)
     (3) Bytes 3-4 => alarm threshold
   - Example: 0x01 01 00 00 03 01 00 14 => the breaker supports short-circuit alarm (with auto trip, threshold 0), and overload alarm (with trip at 20 kW). No other alarms.
4. Communication logic:
   - After pairing, the breaker reports these alarm capabilities to the cloud.
   - On power-up, it also reports once.
   - The panel can then send alarm settings.
properties.name: Alarm settings 1

properties.description:
1. Alarm threshold enable and configuration
2. HEX format, Big-endian
3. Packet format:
   - Each alarm is 4 bytes:
     (1) Byte 1 => alarm present (1) or not (0)
     (2) Byte 2 => if triggered, breaker action (0x01 = trip, 0x00 = no trip, just alarm)
     (3) Bytes 3-4 => alarm threshold
   - Example: 0x01 01 00 3C 03 01 00 F5 => Overcurrent alarm (trip at 60 A) and Overvoltage alarm (trip at 245 V)
4. Communication logic:
   - After pairing, the breaker reports these alarm capabilities to the cloud.
   - On power-up, it also reports once.
   - The panel can set alarms via this protocol.
properties.name: Alarm settings 2

properties.description:
1. Device number / ID
2. Big-endian mode, string type
3. Unit precision
4. Packet format
5. Communication logic:
   - During pairing, the breaker sends this ID 3 times to ensure success. If paired, the panel should display the ID.
   - If pairing succeeds but no ID is shown, remove the device and re-pair.
   - Each time the breaker powers up, it also reports the ID once.
properties.name: Device ID display
